attributes.comment:
As a middle-income family currently in the process of adopting a daughter from
China, the increase in the fees for the I600A and 171H will negatively affect us,
and will discourage other middle class families from adopting as well. Currently,
the projected wait time between receipt of our 171H and bringing our daughter
home will be at least 20 months, probably more.
Because our 171H must be current at the time of our dossier submission, its
critical review in China, our being matched with our daugther and for our
appointment with the US Consulate in Ghanzou, we will have to resubmit our I-
600A and re-do our fingerprints at least once.
Given the expirations of the 171H, the new rate increase will mean an additional
cost burden to all families in the process of adopting. This cost will add to the
overall expense of adopting -- an expense that is already out of line with middle
income families. Therefore I ask that the cost increase be reconsidered.

Thank you,
Heather Beebe-Stevens

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Heather A. Beebe-Stevens
